title: OldBodies and OldReceipts numbers in logs not incremented by barrier
body:

Update: Unsure whether this is just a logging issue. Lighthouse wants blocks from 3,749,587 and doesn't appear to be receiving them. Will test with a barrier of 1.

Same with a barrier of 1. 

I am wondering whether specifying a barrier interacts with #2489 . I'll comment there.

This logging question may be a non-issue. If I get this right Nethermind fills Old Bodies and Receipts in reverse order, the logs would be expected and correct as seen, then, and this issue can be closed.

the logs on your side look fine so maybe #2489 
Also, I can add the barrier to the counter for better display.
I wonder whether to display 0/10000 or 3740000/3750000

If I get this right, bodies and receipts are filled in backwards: I might get 11,536, that satisfies the barrier, and the software stops getting more. If you change the logs, it becomes 3751536 / 3750000 in that hypothetical case, which is arguably more, not less confusing. Unless you just cap it at the max for display purposes.

Which then is less accurate, but easier to read at a glance.

@dceleda @yorickdowne @tkstanczak I think I resolved it one day, so closing, but feel free to reopen if it is still valid.
